item.title: Private server bots?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Jacmob, post:33, topic:284523”][quote author=Jacmob link=topic=375963.msg3001226#msg3001226 date=1256002077]
I actually made a 525 bot yesterday with a deob that I had lying around (the client hooks and UI at least), but it’s a bit of a waste of time tbh. No it would not be possible to manipulate an old copy of rs.jar to use it with private servers by simply changing the cache location and removing the host check. You would also have to make the same changes to the packet handlers as the private server idiots have.
[/quote]
hello my name is abraham2119 and I start flaming because I can’t read.

ps. abraham, no shit you idiot, of course you can insert getter functions into a private server client.[/quote]hence as to why i posted what i posted, yet even then you kept on arguing, you idiotic inbred

now shut the fuck up

Read full topic

item.title: Private server bots?
item.dc:creator: @Jacmob Jacmob
item.description:

Jacmob:

I actually made a 525 bot yesterday with a deob that I had lying around (the client hooks and UI at least), but it’s a bit of a waste of time tbh. No it would not be possible to manipulate an old copy of rs.jar to use it with private servers by simply changing the cache location and removing the host check. You would also have to make the same changes to the packet handlers as the private server idiots have.

hello my name is abraham2119 and I start flaming because I can’t read.

ps. abraham, no shit you idiot, of course you can insert getter functions into a private server client.

item.title: Private server bots?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

You both don’t understand each other lol.
Jacmob refers to using an old rs.jar of rsbot to connect to a private server, which would indeed involve changing multiple things.
abraham2119 refers to using the private servers client code and inject rsbot accessors in that instead.

In this case abraham2119 made the first mistake, since Jacmob referred to rs.jar and not to the private server cache.

(Note: using current rsbot, for #525 isn’t possible obviously)

Read full topic

item.title: Private server bots?

item.description:

[quote=“Jacmob, post:28, topic:284523”]It will not work. You will not be able to log in. Are you stupid or just too preoccupied with trolling to read what I have said? “remove the invalid host check” was CLEARLY referring to injecting IRETURN.[/quote]it obviously works you fucking bum seeing as how its done with private-server-clients, and how ive done it with current deobs to dump packets, etc

now shut the fuck up

Read full topic

item.title: Private server bots?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Jacmob, post:26, topic:284523”]Go ahead and modify the cache location and remove the invalid host check in Jagex’s 525 client, then connect to a private server and watch it not work.[/quote]are you a fucking troll? do you have any idea what we are talking about?

no one has to remove the ‘invalid host check’, you simply inject ICONST_1, IRETURN instructions in that method. but as you should know, private-server-clients already have that removed in order to connect to their server. i am talking about using an already existent private-server-client and simply insert the respective ‘getter-functions’ for every field in the client that is accessed by rsbot

edit: now refrain from replying since your idiocy is overwhelming

Read full topic

item.title: Private server bots?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Jacmob, post:22, topic:284523”]I actually made a 525 bot yesterday with a deob that I had lying around (the client hooks and UI at least), but it’s a bit of a waste of time tbh. No it would not be possible to manipulate an old copy of rs.jar to use it with private servers by simply changing the cache location and removing the host check. You would also have to make the same changes to the packet handlers as the private server idiots have.[/quote]please refrain from posting until you have a clue on what you are talking about,

the only thing you would have to edit in rsbot for it to work with a private server would be the host, the cache (as stated) the actual client archive loading, and you would have to hook the fields which rsbot accesses, following rsbot’s naming for the get methods used to access the hooked fields

Read full topic

item.title: Private server bots?
item.dc:creator: @Jacmob Jacmob
item.description:
@Jacmob wrote:

I actually made a 525 bot yesterday with a deob that I had lying around (the client hooks and UI at least), but it’s a bit of a waste of time tbh. No it would not be possible to manipulate an old copy of rs.jar to use it with private servers by simply changing the cache location and removing the host check. You would also have to make the same changes to the packet handlers as the private server idiots have.

Read full topic
